name: Libccontainer
tagline: Various data structures implemented in plain C
body:
Description
=============

Why do these esoteric languages like C++ or Java or Python have cool libraries with lots of readily available implementations of data structures like Boost or STL or whatever and such a major language like C has just few such libs ? This projects aim is to change this situation. Hope you will find something useful.

Setup
=====

    cd libccontainer
    bash ./bootstrap
    ./configure --prefix=/usr # if you dont like autotools default (/usr/local)
    make; make install

Whats inside
============

Well tested:
  * Linked list implementation
  * Hash table implementation

Not so well tested:
  * Dynamic storage (malloc/free inside statically allocated buffer)
  * Circular buffer
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
